Docs.param: An identifier for the function to invoke. For example, the value "someScope.someFunction" will invoke the function window.someScope.someFunction.
Docs.summary:
Invokes the specified JavaScript function asynchronously.
will apply timeouts to this operation based on the value configured in . To dispatch a call with a different timeout, or no timeout, consider using .
Docs.returns: An instance of obtained by JSON-deserializing the return value.

Docs.param: An identifier for the function to invoke. For example, the value "someScope.someFunction" will invoke the function window.someScope.someFunction.
A cancellation token to signal the cancellation of the operation. Specifying this parameter will override any default cancellations such as due to timeouts () from being applied.
